subject: Restriction of Maximum Projects per Designated 'Engineer' of Consultancy firms in IE/AE/SC Contracts - reg.
text: HRa <5v TTHRf gifeasrut (434 4ae7 & roArf 4Aq4, HRT TTT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) TrT4q j4a #-5 & 6, #ier-10, anax; #@amt 110 075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 TH/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/Consultancyl 2025 Policy Circular No. 10.1.42/2025 dated 10thJune, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/HQ/SRDAQ/ Misc.-Part(1) (Comp. No.263038)} Sub: Restriction of Maximum Projects per Designated 'Engineer' of Consultancy Firms in IEIAEISC Contracts -reg: The Review/ Monitoring/ Supervision of the Projects is being carried out by the Consultants engaged as IE/ AEISC according to mode of execution of Civil Contracts The compliance of specification and Contract Provisions is primarily controlled and supervised by the Consultancy' $ Personnel Teams mobilized at the Project Site and also monitored and controlled by Designated 'Engineer' assigned to particular Project. 2. Various clauses of HAM Agreements provide but not limited the following: i. Appointment of Independent Engineer as per Schedule-M: ji. Designation of up to 02 Persons as Authorized Signatories by Independent Engineer as per Clause 21.5. jii. Inspection of Project and Construction Works by Independent Engineer once every month as per Para-5.3 of Annex-| (Schedule-N)_ iv. Inspection of Project once every month during Maintenance period and submission of O&M Inspection Report by Independent Engineer as per Para-6.4 of Annex-| (Schedule-N) 3 Further, various clauses of EPC Agreements provide but not limited the following: i. Appointment of Authority' s Engineer as per Schedule-N: ji. Delegation of Duties and Responsibilities to suitably qualified and experienced Personnel by Authority's Engineer as per Clause 18.3. jii. Inspection of Project Highway and Construction Works by Authority' s Engineer and submission of Monthly Inspection Report as per Para-4 (vii) of Annex-I (Schedule- N) iv. Regular   Inspections by  Authority' $ Engineer , at least once  every month, for evaluation of compliance with the Maintenance requirements and submission of Maintenance Report as per Para-5 (ii) of Annex-I (Schedule-N)_ 4. It is observed that the   Consultancy Firms (as  IEZAEISC) are assigning Civil Project's Supervision obligations to the Authorized Person/ Designated 'Engineer' for many Projects. Due to more no. of Civil Projects in hand, the Authorized Person/ Designated 'Engineer' may not be able to fulfil Contractual obligations and ensure monitoring of the Field Team adequately and therefore defeats the purpose in reference to qualitative and quantitative monitoring of the Project, required as per the Contractual Provisions. 5 . In view of above, for improvement of Quality and Supervision Mechanism, it has been decided to restrict the no. of Projects to Maximum Limit of 10 Projects under Construction or Maintenance Stage per 'Engineer' of Consultancy Firms Contd_ 08 2/ - 5005 NHA Key for, to, for, to,
